elements.title: Triệu Quân Sự (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Vietnamese prisoner Triệu Quân Sự (pictured) escaped from jail four times, and was twice caught while playing online games at internet cafés?

elements.title: a British school inspired by a circus tent (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while a British school inspired by a circus tent was described as "eclectic and witty", its "plain functional" replacement won an RIBA Award?

elements.title: Panka Pelishek (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the pianist Panka Pelishek was a Heroine of Socialist Labor?

elements.title: 29 BC Yellow River flood (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that China's imperial chancellor committed suicide after he was blamed for the devastation of the 29 BC Yellow River flood?

elements.title: Ruth El Saffar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a hospitalized Ruth El Saffar had to dictate the introduction of her final book to Diana de Armas Wilson, with whom she had co-edited Quixotic Desire?

elements.title: a public service announcement about drunk driving (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a public service announcement about drunk driving was voted the best television advertisement in New Zealand?

elements.title: Denise Stoklos (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Denise Stoklos's "essential theatre" involves minimizing her acting methods while maximizing "the power of drama"?

elements.title: Donald Trump applies his own makeup (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Donald Trump applies his own makeup each day, according to his former press secretary?

elements.title: Spencer Reid (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that where NFL player Spencer Reid is from, "There's no McDonald's. There's no nothing"?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Parahyangan

The West Javanese region centred around Java's third largest city of Bandung is an excellent place to hike and admire active volcanoes.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Sekigahara

This quaint mountain town and battlefield, where Tokugawa won control of Japan, gives visitors firsthand insight into feudal Japanese warfare.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Driving in China

China isn't one of the countries that foreigners commonly explore by driving themselves. If you'd still like to, the first step would be getting a local driving licence.
